Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2015 12:26AM Penzance wrote: Hi Andrea I also had pain in the breast and the armpit after a biosy. It even came back several months later when a physio handled my back a bit roughly (no pillow under tummy). My other physio who has a lot of experience of bc topd me it's normal: wound healing inside the breast + lymphatic system evacuating debris. I wouldn't have my in law do a u/s on me. Can't you see a non family member? Best wishes
Posts.Title: Fibroadenoma Andrea6664 tgoldens

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2016 01:15PM Penzance wrote: Wow, Nancy, this is very good news indeed, and very useful to know for other patients (and their doctors).As you pointed out, doctors can and do forget: they are only humans after all. Keeping my fingers crossed in the hope this will continue working for you for a long time.
Posts.Title: Recycled chemo - looks like it is working nancyh Moissy

Posts.Content: May 16, 2017 07:21AM Penzance wrote: That's a relief, so glad for you. Re the anxiety, before my dx, I had 0 foreshadowing, 0 apprehension: half a dozen doctors had looked at the fibro and thought it was just a big fibro... And it didnt it wasnt a ductal, but they found some lobular ( which does not form lumps). It felt so unreal, I nearly thought it was a practical joke :) Best wishes, thinking of your dad.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer at 25, no BC history in family? jsn1904 MTwoman

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2015 08:06PM Penzance wrote: 39. Was thinking about getting married and having a child. Perfect timing!
Posts.Title: Would you mind sharing your age at time of diagnosis? ByFaith Gussy

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2015 03:02PM Penzance wrote: If I understand correctly, a fibro is an enlarged lobule, so it would make sense that some LCIS might disguise as fibros. Apparently that's what happened to me, and they also found carcinoma in the surrounding area. The radiologist was very surprised too, he said the incidence was 0.01% and if I hadn't had an existing diagnosis, he wouldn't even have recommended a biopsy. Found the following article on PubMed: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/6329129 Good luck to you all.
Posts.Title: Cancer within Fibroadenoma SummerAngel MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2015 03:30PM Penzance wrote: Hi Etna. I was 39 and couldn't believe it either: no family history, reasonably fit, healthy BMI, and everyone had told me it looked like a bog standard fibroadenoma. I was very, very shocked and extremely angry. Still am, especially after stupid Pinktober. Looks like your radiologist and doctor are on the ball. MD Anderson has a great reputation, you're lucky to live nearby. Hope people around you are supportive. Lots of info on here, don't hesitate to ask questions, and I would second the notebook tip. It helps you 'screen' doctors too: I find out that I don't get along with the ones who won't let me ask questions. Best wishes.
Posts.Title: Just found out today - I have breast cancer. etnasgrl mesharon1959
